speaker: 07_MARY
text: God, I said I wasn't gonna do this anymore. Stay up late. Kinda defeats the purpose of getting up in the morning.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: I know. And it's a hard habit to break. Usually I don't.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: S- uh Usually I don't stay up late. But it's like, if I'm up after midnight. It's just like...

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: God I still can't believe Tim bitching around and, he lied too. He said that he talked to Ron, and all this other shit.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: About uh the way they were feeling, of them being the only ones cleaning the house, and all this other shit. I mean what they don't realize, is like, shit, when Ron gets home from work, I wanna spend time with Ron, because Ron, usually doesn't get home till nine or ten.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: Unlike Tim, he has to work, for every little dime that he makes. You know.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: Yeah, Tim is on salary, and he can take leave, and.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: He gets sick leave, we don't get shit.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: I don't know. It is really hard living with another couple.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: I mean, we. If we set our. If we sit down and set some rules, which we never did, uh uh it could work. You know.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: What it amounts to, is mutual r- respect, and l- like Tim told Ron, he told him, he goes um, what was it he goes, nobody fucks with my lifestyle. I feel the exact same way. And all those bitches and complaints that he has, they're about my lifestyle.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: And that's what I'm gonna tell him.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: And the only way it's gonna work, is if we have respect for one another.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: And it doesn't mean, going to our parents, and complaining about one another, I'm gonna tell him, if you have any complaints, you talk to the person that you have the complaint about. I'm also going to suggest, weekly house meetings to discuss such things.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: Mhm. Oh yeah. Yeah. You know what it would be, a real good lesson for them, too, in self assertiveness.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: You know and, especially the way um, I mean Tim gets in- himself into a, uncomfortable situation or whatever, and his first reaction is to blow up about it.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: You know, cause he let... he lets it pile up.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: He doesn't do nothing positive about it, and then he just blows up.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: And if something bothers you, you go and you, I was, like last year, I was really proud of myself, when I was asked to take over intermediate algebra.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: And I asked for a raise, instead of...

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: Cause instead of just sitting in the class and getting five dollars an hour, I was now gonna be up there teaching it.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: And instead of getting the five dollars an hour, I ended up getting fifteen.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: But I went and I asked. Now if i-. You know if you put a situation like that to Tim or Mandy, cause not because they're they're weak in character or anything, but because they're.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: Yeah. They hem and haw around, and somebody else would have to talk for them. You know.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: I don't know. And it's, Right now uh, I don't know if I should mention it to him, or what, but, I'm feeling like he's taking me for granted.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: Yep. And he's rolling in it, Mary. And you know what the sad thing, the thing that really scares me... is that they're n-... th- at the rate they're going, and with all the breaks that they've gotten, they're never gonna have hard times.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: Like I came over here to work with Danae, which is what I'm going to do, I'm going to do some translations for her and stuff.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: You know, I have to make at least fifty dollars or so...

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: To make it worth my time, but like tonight, well I called, you know, this thing was going on with Buck and everything, so I called um, Mandy's, or, I called our house, and Mandy answered the phone, and I said where's... you know where's... where. Is Ron there. And she said no. When we were on our way to Tim's game, he was at Town Pump, and he asked what time we'd be home, and we said probably about nine. And she said then we went over to your grandma's, but then we came back, and he wasn't here yet. So, I called the Town Pump, and asked if he was still in the casino, course he wasn't, he was on his way home. And I said tell. So I called Mandy back, and I told her to, have him call me... when he got home. So, I was in the bathtub when he called, and I talked to him for a while and, he went and, he was really down about what what I told him that Tim had said to me, and how I was so upset. He goes why didn't you tell him to go and wake me up. I said I did, and he wouldn't do it.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: Mhm. He goes, they w-... they were sitting around getting all fucked up, he said but, he said I went right to bed, he said I didn't get done working until after nine.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: Cause that five-car pile up they had between Hardin and Crow.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: Oh, shit, really. I didn't hear about it.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: Yeah. Ron was singlehandedly there... with one wrecker.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: Seems like any time I've seen a wrecker out here, there's always two guys in there.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: Hm-m <XX>, everyone was gone, when the call came in.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: And Jay's not supposed to go on those anymore, because of his heart, so he had to send Ron by himself, and Ron was slowly pulling everybody out of the ditch.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: Did they all hit each other. Or just.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: Kind of. A- a semi bumped a car, and then went and, went on two wheels, and, just about lost it, and then got back up on all all its wheels again.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: Oh. Did it land in the ditch.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: But it. Kind of, it was able to get out, but all the other cars that were in the direct vicinity, all hit the ditch. And then, there was three cars and the semi. And then, this uh, this guy pulled up and...

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: He was going to uh, Peggy...

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: Him and her pulled up, and they were in the van. And they stopped to ask Ron what happened. And here another car came and rear-ended em.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: And they ended up having to take um Peggy White by helicopter to Billings.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: I know. Darn, this darn dog keeps breathing, and like dreaming, you know I wonder if we should wake her up.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: No, she'll get scared and want to go outside. Kinda nervous, you know.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: They say you can really mess up a dog, by waking em up when they're dreaming.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: Mhm. It's so cold outside, but yet sometimes she insists on staying out there.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: I know. You know what I was thinking of doing.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: I don't know, she's kind of shy, but I was wondering...

speaker: 07_MARY
text: What it would be like to train her...

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: I don't know if she'd do it.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: I don't know if she would either. She's kind of timid.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: Mhm. She doesn't trust too many people at all.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: Oh and you know another thing that Tim had the audacity to bitch about.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: He said um, Mandy had to stay up all by herself and decorate the tree... until four in the morning. And I even asked if we could put our ornaments on there, and they told me that there wouldn't be enough room.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: She was probably lonely when she was doing it, you know that. She probably was... <XX>.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: I sat up with her, and I was talking to her, she was doing all the decorating, I mean, what was I gonna do. She- I mean, she was just putting up the balls and everything and, she'd say where, where do you think this should go and, so I was sitting there doing my Welfare application. And uh, you know I was just sitting there watching her, telling her where to put everything and what not.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: Did you know Nickie wanted her own tree.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: And I forgot to bring it in, it's outside.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: What are you gonna do with it.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: She wants to set it up for her Barbies. I was just gonna use a tin can and put rocks in the bottom.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: And just stick it in there. And you know what I did.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: I didn't want to waste a tree's life...

speaker: 07_MARY
text: So I just cut a branch off one. God, I fell up there...

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: Where'd you go... to get em.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: You know where Sarah and Arvela live.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: Just around the corner. Remember that first cattle guard you go over.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: I didn't even go over that.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: You mean, kinda like by the... by the tunnel.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: And I just walked up. We just walked up around uh, that area, God Alice that was fun.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: Did you get grandma a tree too.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: Hm-m. That pickup could only hold like three.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: Mm. I wonder why. Did daddy say to take the pickup back. Or what was the deal.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: Oh, you didn't hear about it.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: Oh, you did, about how the engine was on fire.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: See there was oil spilling out, leaking out from the valve cover.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: The valve cover gasket apparently cracked or whatever, and there was oil coming out, and the oil got hot, and you know how it gets hot and smokes.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: Well, I guess enough came out, because we were losing oil bad, going from Billings to Crow, um, there's a lot of...

speaker: 07_MARY
text: Smoke coming out, and by the time we got to Hardin, we had to put like uh, three or four quarts in.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: It was three. And, by the time we got to...

speaker: 07_MARY
text: Crow, it was, it was one quart low. And there was smoke still coming from under the engine, I figure w- if it was losing that much oil, then it caught fire.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: Cause the engine was hot, cause there wasn't enough water in the radiator.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: I talked to Oscar about it, and he said, well I checked, it was only, it was only about, I'd say a half a quart to a quart short of water. But that shouldn't make any difference. He goes the only thing I can think of, is that there was an air lock in there...

speaker: 07_MARY
text: And that running the engine out on the open road.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: Caused that air lock to come through... flushed it out.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: No, it would more or less um, the engine wasn't being kept cool enough. Cause there wasn't enough fluid in the radiator...

speaker: 07_MARY
text: And, you know how the radiator's, the pipe's close to other parts of the engine.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: It was some part in there.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: The engine being too hot, and the oil leaking.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: So he knew that the oil was leaking.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: No, we knew we were losing oil, but we didn't know where. I just figured it was from that valve cover gasket. Just from lifting up the hood and looking at it.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: Well, and two of his wires, the sparkplug wires.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: Were fried all the way through.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: So we took those off and we, replaced them with some old ones out of the garage.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: And it runs. It runs. There's enough uh, radiator fluid in there.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: So that it will, It's it's enough.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: But I think running it out on the open road, will cause it possibly to shoot more oil out.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: That valve cover gasket has to be replaced.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: I don't know. Oh I freaked Cookie and, Rita and, Gary out tonight. Remember the Plain- Plainfeather uh Claypit... where that red clay is.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: Right there. I saw my my speedometer just go Brr... like that just down. You know, and I knew exactly what it was. What I have to do, is take off the distributor wire, and splice it in with the fuel pump wire.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: Because my fuel pump is now electric, Never used to be.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: Hand me that ashtray. Or your light, I mean. Your light. It's behind the sewing machine...

speaker: 07_MARY
text: And uh, sometimes it gets loose...

speaker: 07_MARY
text: So I stopped the car, and they said what are you doing. I said, oh, I gotta tighten this wire here. So I had Cookie turn on the ignition and turn it off. So, cause see, once you turn that key on, then you hear the, the fuel pump come on.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: And if the wire's not connected right, it doesn't come on.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: So I did that, and I lit a match to find out where I was, and, n- after everything was hunky-dory, then I, shut the hood, and got back in, and I started up the engine and, both Gary and Rita were sitting on the edges of their seat. And I turned around and I looked, and I said, did I scare you kids. They wouldn't say anything, then Gary goes, yeah, I was scared...

speaker: 07_MARY
text: But I freaked em out, I don't know. Then daddy said something about the steering column on my car needing work.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: Said long as I don't drive it fast, it should be alright. But oh man I don't know. See the thing about it is, if I go after Ken, I'm not really gonna have any money.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: To um, you know, do things. I'm not saying I'm gonna pay for everything, but, I don't want to be broke around him...

speaker: 07_MARY
text: Cause I wanna at least be able to put gas in the car...

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: I don't think it's such a good idea for you to go up there in the winter.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: Mm. I've been thinking about that.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: We should all get some money together and, is there any way he could like...

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: Meet us in Great Falls or something. Cause I'd like to go up there and go to the, um, Red Lobster.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: Yeah. Cause I've been just, craving seafood.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: That's the half-way point, he could do it.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: I bet he could do it. When though.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: He goes back to school like the second.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: Uh, Oh, shoot. Well isn't there any way, like we... that we could just meet him up there and, maybe.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: Bring him down, or, I don't wanna take your car...

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: I was gonna ask you and mom, too, if you could um, take care of Trace for a couple days next week.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: Oh. What you got in mind.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: I need to get caught up on my work.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: Wednesday I have an appointment at nine thirty.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: Yeah I think that'd, I think that'd um, work out, like if she had to go shopping or something maybe you could go with her, and help her with him. And Nicky helps her with him alot anyway.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: And then of course he adores me...

speaker: 07_MARY
text: I remember I was pregnant with Nicky. And uh, Boots's little boy, he really liked me.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: When I was pregnant with her.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: Uh You know how it is when we're pregnant, we get real sleepy.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: I'd fall asleep on the couch, and he'd lay by me.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: And he'd fall asleep with me. And I remember he would. I woke up, and here he was gone, his mother carried him in the other room.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: And God, that kind of pissed me off.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: Was. Would um, Was Nicky mad when Trace was a boy.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: Kind of. She thinks I should have twins. Twin girls...

speaker: 07_MARY
text: But I don't think she'll realize the uh, sibling rivalry...

speaker: 07_MARY
text: But I don't know, she's six years old now. And they say that if there's six years between children, there's not that much rivalry.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: They're kind of in different worlds.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: Yeah. Because, see, Trace will be, the next time I have a baby, Trace will probably be, about three... four.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: That's when I'm gonna get this shit taken out...

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: Tammy Kashen has one of these too.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: Deon told me. Cause I asked him what his intentions were with her. Cause I told him I thought he was too young to be so involved.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: Gwen was telling me that, Did she talk to you lately.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: They had a cyst on her ovary. And they had to go in and take it out.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: And it's really screwed up her uh.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: And they said that she might have to get pregnant again, just to straighten it out...

speaker: 07_MARY
text: So, and then she goes, so tell... tell Deon. And she really laughed...

speaker: 07_MARY
text: I don't know if Tammy would be too happy with that though. Seems to me that she's trying to straighten herself out, and, pursue a family.

speaker: 07_MARY
text: Or do you think it might be a matter of convenience.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: I think it's a convenience for both of em.

speaker: 07_ALIC
text: It's also a convenience for Cookie.
